cleaned_text: What is cancer? Cancer is a diseased condition in which there is uncontrolled growth of a group of cells along with tendency of spreading or metastasis to other locations via lymph or blood. Cancer ( [Homeopathy for Types of Cancer](https://hpathy.com/cause-symptoms-treatment/cancer-types/)) manifests itself in the form of tumor or leukemia. According to location of occurrence various kind of cancers are there like, lungs cancer, stomach cancer, breast cancer, liver cancer, oral cancer, esophagus cancer, colorectal cancer etc. Lung cancer is the most common cause of death all over the world. Almost all malignant cancers are associated with pain. There are some specific pain conditions in specific type of cancer - Lung cancer - pain in chest along with cough, breathlessness and haemoptysis. - Breast cancer - pain with lump and nipple discharge - Gastro intestinal cancer - abdominal distension along with pain with haematemasis, melana, fresh bleeding per rectum, dysphagia and many other symptoms. - CNS cancer - head pain with vomiting and obtundation caused due to raised intra cranial pressure. - Genitourinary cancer - pelvic pain with haematuria and other obstructive urinary symptoms. - Gynecological cancer - pelvic pain bleeding and vaginal discharge. - Ear, nose and throat cancer - pain or difficulty on swallowing along with deafness, dysphonia, blocked nose, nasal discharge and ulcers in affected area. Etiology of cancer Alcohol - excessive intake of alcohol can cause various types of cancer like liver cancer, esophageal cancer. Smoking - it is a most common cause of lung cancer. Tobacco - excessive use of tobacco can easily cause oral cancer Ultraviolet rays - UV rays causes damage to the skin which ultimately leads to skin cancer Rich diet - heavy or fatty diet may cause cancer of colon, pancreas and uterus. Incidence is increased in persons who consume red meat, spices, salt-fish etc. Family history - previous researches have shown that cancer may be hereditary also, it can run in families. Precancerous conditions - if there is any pre cancerous condition present it can lead to cancer. Chemical carcinogen - like asbestos, cadmium, nickel can cause cancer. Diagnosis of Cancer Diagnosis depends upon type of cancer. Some common diagnosis includes CT scan, MRI, X-RAY, ultrasonography, biopsy of tissue.
